item.title: It Looks Like a Riders Republic Movie Is Happening for Some Reason
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/riders-republic-movie-report

According to a new report, a movie based on Ubisoft's extreme sports racer Riders Republic is in the works, and I'd love to meet literally anyone who asked for such a project.

Per a Deadline article, the Riders Republic movie will be a co-production between French movie house Gaumont and Ubisoft, and it'll be directed by Bad Boys: Ride or Die helmsmen Adil El Arbi and Bilall Fallah, colloquially known as Adil & Bilall.

Writing duties on the project will be handled by The World Is Yours and Stillwater scribe Noé Debré, although it's not clear whether there will be any other writers on the movie or whether Debré will be the sole writer.

This won't be Ubisoft's first foray into multimedia; the company is currently gearing up for the release of Netflix animated series Splinter Cell: Deathwatch, which is set to launch sometime later this year. Lest we forget, there's also 2023's Netflix series Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.

Indeed, Riders Republic is just one of a number of video game movies in the works right now. Others include a movie based on EA's hit multiplayer game Split Fiction, as well as a movie based on horror work sim The Mortuary Assistant and an adaptation of Sega's racer OutRun.

Video games are also proving ripe territory for series adaptations. Amazon's wildly successful Fallout series, for instance, is set to air its second season later this year, and a third season has already been greenlit. HBO's The Last of Us, meanwhile, is partway through its second season at time of writing.

These shows join animated fare like Netflix's Devil May Cry and Castlevania shows, as well as Prime Video's Secret Level, an anthology series with shorts based on properties like Warhammer 40k, Armored Core, and, er, Concord.

Naturally, the Riders Republic movie doesn't have a release date yet, and we don't know who's attached to star in it either. It's likely we'll learn more about the project in the coming months, but don't expect it to arrive in cinemas for a while.
